result.execSummary:
All charges against Keith Allen Pettis in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Keith Allen Pettis is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith Allen Pettis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keith Allen Pettis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Keith Allen Pettis.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a jury trial.  State is not ready to proceed, and Defense moves to dismiss.  Court ordered case DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE.  Case closed.
Received and Filed: Defense's Motion in Limine

Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Keith Allen Pettis.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Matter continues to be in trial posture.  No outstanding motions or issues raised by the parties.  Jury Trial remains calendared on October 3, 2022 at 9:00 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  nk
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report - 8-09-2022

Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Parties are advised that this matter is re-assigned due to the defendants lower pending matter 21CF3347.

Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Smith. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with L.M.P and K.M.P
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

03:52 PM Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 3. Defense motion to dismiss Use of a Dangerous Weapon Enhancer. Court GRANT motion to dismiss without predjudice count 3 ehnancer (939.63(1)(b))-Use of a Dangerous Weapon.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
